Package components

Class Game

java.lang.Object
components.Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game class represents the main logic of a card game. It manages the game state, player turns, card plays, and determines the winner of the game.

The game follows standard Uno rules with additional logic to handle special cards (e.g., Reverse, Skip, Draw Two, Wild, Wild Draw Four) and player actions.

The class uses the Deck and Player classes to handle the deck of cards and player interactions, respectively.

Usage example: 

 
 List<Player> players = new ArrayList<>();
 // Add players to the list...
 Game unoGame = new Game(players);
 unoGame.play();

Note: This implementation assumes standard Uno rules and might require modification for variations in specific Uno game implementations.

      public void drawCards(int numCards, int playerIndex)
      Gives the specified user the specified number of cards from the deck and skips their turn.
      Parameters:
      numCards - the number of cards to draw
      playerIndex - the index of the player who will draw the cards

    • wildDrawFour

      public Color wildDrawFour()
      Handles a Wild Draw Four by giving four cards to the next player and letting the current player choose the color for the top card.

      the chosen color for the top card
